result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:27 pm 
INCLUDES 21CM614 & 22CF246. 
State appears by ADA Davis Runde; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Peter Vu. 

**WARRANT QUASHED**

INITIAL APPEARANCE IN 22CF246. 
Reading Waived. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

PLEA: Not Guilty to misd. 

Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $15,000 cash bond to cover both files - CONDITIONS: 
- No driving without valid dl. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 

BRANCH 6 CASE. 
RH: 3/4/2022 at 1pm in 101.  
Prelim: 3/9/2022 at 9:50 am in Br. 2.

INCLUDES 21CM614 & 22CF246.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.     Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
